ListItem.name: LI_cTX_44567
ListItem.title: cTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_cT0_41284
ListItem.title: cT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_cTis_Paget_37620
ListItem.title: cTis (Paget): Paget disease of the nipple NOT associated with invasive carcinoma and / or carcinoma in situ (DCIS) in the underlying breast parenchyma. Carcinomas in the breast parenchyma associated with Paget disease are categorized based on the size and characteristics of the parenchymal disease, although the presence of Paget disease should still be noted.

ListItem.name: LI_cT1_41258
ListItem.title: cT1: Tumor less than or equal to 20 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_cT1mi_46966
ListItem.title: cT1mi: Tumor less than or equal to 1 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_cT1a_49130
ListItem.title: cT1a: Tumor greater than 1 mm but less than or equal to 5 mm in greatest dimension (round any measurement greater than 1.0-1.9 mm to 2 mm).

ListItem.name: LI_cT1b_59950
ListItem.title: cT1b: Tumor greater than 5 mm but less than or equal to 10 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_cT1c_57786
ListItem.title: cT1c: Tumor greater than 10 mm but less than or equal to 20 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_cT2_47607
ListItem.title: cT2: Tumor greater than 20 mm but less than or equal to 50 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_cT3_49771
ListItem.title: cT3: Tumor greater than 50 mm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_cT4_53979
ListItem.title: cT4: Tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and / or to the skin (ulceration or macroscopic nodules); invasion of the dermis alone does not qualify as T4

ListItem.name: LI_cT4a_59137
ListItem.title: cT4a: Extension to the chest wall; invasion or adherence to pectoralis muscle in the absence of invasion of chest wall structures does not qualify as T4

ListItem.name: LI_cT4b_52599
ListItem.title: cT4b: Ulceration and / or ipsilateral macroscopic satellite nodules and / or edema (including peau d'orange) carcinoma

ListItem.name: LI_cT4c_52708
ListItem.title: cT4c: Both T4a and T4b are present

ListItem.name: LI_cNX_47627
ListItem.title: cNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed )

ListItem.name: LI_cN0_47730
ListItem.title: cN0: No regional lymph node metastases (by imaging or clinical examination)

ListItem.name: LI_cN1_56495
ListItem.title: cN1: Metastases to movable ipsilateral Level I, II axillary lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_cN1mi_46840
ListItem.title: cN1mi: Micrometastases (approximately 200 cells, larger than 0.2 mm, but none larger than 2.0 mm)

ListItem.name: LI_cN2_49897
ListItem.title: cN2: Metastases in ipsilateral Level I, II axillary lymph nodes that are clinically fixed or matted; or in ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases

ListItem.name: LI_cN2a_44424
ListItem.title: cN2a: Metastases in ipsilateral Level I, II axillary lymph nodes fixed to one another (matted) or to other structures

ListItem.name: LI_cN2b_48772
ListItem.title: cN2b: Metastases only in ipsilateral internal mammary nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases

ListItem.name: LI_cN3_49651
ListItem.title: cN3: Metastases in ipsilateral infraclavicular (Level III axillary) lymph node(s) with or without Level I, II axillary lymph node involvement; or in ipsilateral internal mammary lymph node(s) with Level I, II axillary lymph node metastases; or metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph node(s) with or without axillary or internal mammary lymph node involvement

ListItem.name: LI_cN3a_50916
ListItem.title: cN3a: Metastases in ipsilateral infraclavicular lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_cN3b_39077
ListItem.title: cN3b: Metastases in ipsilateral internal mammary lymph node(s) and axillary lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_cN3c_43405
ListItem.title: cN3c: Metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_cM0_44570
ListItem.title: cM0: No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases

ListItem.name: LI_cM0i_53226
ListItem.title: cM0(i+): No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases in the presence of tumor cells or deposits no larger than 0.2 mm detected microscopically or by molecular techniques in circulating blood, bone marrow, or other nonregional nodal tissue in a patient without symptoms or signs of metastases

ListItem.name: LI_cM1_42555
ListItem.title: cM1: Distant metastases detected by clinical and radiographic means

ListItem.name: LI_pM1_48878
ListItem.title: pM1: Any histologically proven metastases in distant organs; or if in non-regional nodes, metastases greater than 0.2 mm

ListItem.name: LI_Surg_36873
ListItem.title: Surgical (use pTNM and p stage after surgery)

ListItem.name: LI_Neo_36950
ListItem.title: Neoadjuvant (use ypTNM after surgery to record residual tumor, no p stage)

ListItem.name: LI_NonSurg_38058
ListItem.title: Non-surgical (may use ycTNM after treatment, no p stage)

ListItem.name: LI_NoTx_45154
ListItem.title: No treatment (no yp or yc for TNM, no p stage)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50996
DisplayedItem.title: Note: If there are multiple invasive carcinomas, size, grade, histologic type, and the results of studies for estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR), and HER2 should pertain to the largest invasive carcinoma. If smaller invasive carcinomas differ in any of these features, this information may be included in the "Comments" section.

ListItem.name: LI_52433
ListItem.title: Total mastectomy (including nipple-sparing and skin-sparing mastectomy)

Question.name: Q_TSite_Clock_Position_58267
Question.title: Specify Clock Position of Tumor Site

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43651
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The histologic type corresponds to the largest carcinoma. If there are smaller carcinomas of a different type, this information should be included under "Additional Pathologic Findings."

DisplayedItem.name: DI_53730
DisplayedItem.title: Inflammatory carcinoma requires the presence of clinical findings of erythema and edema involving at least one-third or more of the skin of the breast (see "Note M").

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41095
DisplayedItem.title: Special type carcinomas should consist of at least 90% pure pattern.

ListItem.name: LI_Inv_Ductal_Ca_40239
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma of no special type (ductal, not otherwise specified)

ListItem.name: LI_InvCa_Ductal_Lobular_Features_54042
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma with ductal and lobular features ("mixed type carcinoma")

ListItem.name: LI_47819
ListItem.title: Metaplastic carcinoma, mixed epithelial and mesenchymal type

ListItem.name: LI_47252
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma with clear cell (glycogen rich) features

ListItem.name: LI_49293
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma, with signet-ring cell features

ListItem.name: LI_InvCa_Type_CBD_52333
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma, type cannot be determined

ListItem.name: LI_Score_1_50561
ListItem.title: Score 1 (> 75% of tumor area forming glandular / tubular structures)

ListItem.name: LI_Score_2_49233
ListItem.title: Score 2 (10 to 75% of tumor area forming glandular / tubular structures)

ListItem.name: LI_Score_3_47335
ListItem.title: Score 3 (< 10% of tumor area forming glandular / tubular structures)

ListItem.name: LI_Score_1_47504
ListItem.title: Score 1 (Nuclei small with little increase in size in comparison with normal breast epithelial cells, regular outlines, uniform nuclear chromatin, little variation in size)

ListItem.name: LI_Score_2_43568
ListItem.title: Score 2 (Cells larger than normal with open vesicular nuclei, visible nucleoli, and moderate variability in both size and shape)

ListItem.name: LI_Score_3_48732
ListItem.title: Score 3 (Vesicular nuclei, often with prominent nucleoli, exhibiting marked variation in size and shape, occasionally with very large and bizarre forms)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39409
DisplayedItem.title: Note: See Table 1 in CAP Protocol.

Question.name: Q_Nottingham_Num_Mitoses_44796
Question.title: Number of Mitoses per 10 High-Power Fields

Question.name: Q_Nottingham_Dia_Micro_Field_mm_58556
Question.title: Diameter of Microscope Field in Millimeters (mm)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59970
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The grade corresponds to the largest area of invasion. If there are smaller foci of invasion of a different grade, this information should be included under "Additional Pathologic Findings."

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38722
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The size of the invasive carcinoma should take into consideration the gross findings correlated with the microscopic examination. If multiple foci of invasion are present, the size listed is the size of the largest contiguous area of invasion. The size of multiple invasive carcinomas should not be added together. The size does not include adjacent ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS). For any carcinoma larger than 1.0 mm but less than 1.5 mm, the size should not be rounded down to 1.0 mm, but rather rounded up to 2.0 mm, to ensure that the tumor is not miscategorized as pT1mi.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_40511
DisplayedItem.title: If there has been a prior core needle biopsy or incisional biopsy showing a larger area of invasion than in the excisional specimen, the largest dimension of the invasive carcinoma in the prior specimen should be used for T classification, if known. This also applies if the entire tumor has been removed by prior biopsy.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_58015
DisplayedItem.title: If there has been prior neoadjuvant treatment and no invasive carcinoma is present, the cancer is classified as ypTis if there is residual DCIS and ypT0 if there is no remaining carcinoma. A checklist is not required if no cancer is present in the specimen.

ListItem.name: LI_59343
ListItem.title: Greatest dimension of largest invasive focus > 1 mm (specify exact measurement in Millimeters (mm))

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59014
DisplayedItem.title: Note: If there are multiple invasive carcinomas, size, grade, histologic type, and the results of studies for estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PgR), and HER2 should pertain to the largest invasive carcinoma. If smaller invasive carcinomas differ in any of these features, this information may be included in the “Comments” section.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_53561
DisplayedItem.title: Note: If there has been prior neoadjuvant treatment and only residual DCIS, the cancer is classified as ypTis.

ListItem.title: Only DCIS is present after presurgical (neoadjuvant) therapy

DisplayedItem.name: DI_44195
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The size (extent) of DCIS is an estimation of the volume of breast tissue occupied by DCIS. This information may be helpful for cases with a predominant component of DCIS (e.g., DCIS with microinvasion) but may not be necessary for cases of EIC negative invasive carcinomas.

ListItem.name: LI_wo_Skin_Ulceration_39535
ListItem.title: Invasive carcinoma directly invades into the dermis or epidermis without skin ulceration (this does not change the T stage)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_53103
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Satellite skin nodules must be separate from the primary tumor and macroscopically identified to assign a category as T4b. Skin nodules identified only on microscopic examination and in the absence of epidermal ulceration or skin edema (clinical peau d'orange) do not qualify as T4b. Such tumors should be categorized based on tumor size.

ListItem.name: LI_Satellite_Skin_Foci_InvCa_Id_50232
ListItem.title: Satellite skin foci of invasive carcinoma are present (i.e., not contiguous with the invasive carcinoma in the breast) (classified as T4b)

Section.name: S_45300
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note M)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_47464
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_47464_1
Property.val: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43402
DisplayedItem.title: # For the purposes of this checklist, these categories should only be used in the setting of preoperative (neoadjuvant) therapy for which a previously diagnosed invasive carcinoma is no longer present after treatment. Patients with pathological complete response (absence of residual invasive carcinoma in both the breast and lymph nodes) should be categorized as ypT0N0 or ypTisN0, not ypTX.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_36870
DisplayedItem.title: Choose a category based on lymph nodes received with the specimen; immunohistochemistry and / or molecular studies are not required.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41198
DisplayedItem.title: Note: The (sn) modifier is added to the N category when a sentinel node biopsy is performed (using either dye or tracer) and fewer than six lymph nodes are removed (sentinel and nonsentinel). The (f) modifier is added to the N category to denote confirmation of metastasis by fine needle aspiration/core needle biopsy with NO further resection of nodes.

ListItem.name: LI_sn_47086
ListItem.title: (sn): Only sentinel node(s) evaluated. If 6 or more nodes (sentinel or nonsentinel) are removed, this modifier should not be used.

ListItem.name: LI_58596
ListItem.title: (f): Nodal metastasis confirmed by fine needle aspiration or core needle biopsy.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_55224
DisplayedItem.title: If internal mammary lymph nodes, infraclavicular nodes (level III axillary), or supraclavicular lymph nodes are included in the specimen, consult the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual for additional lymph node categories.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_38682
DisplayedItem.title: Note: (sn) and (f) suffixes should be added to the N category to denote confirmation of metastasis by sentinel node biopsy or FNA / core needle biopsy respectively, with NO further resection of nodes.

ListItem.name: LI_pNX_40305
ListItem.title: pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., not removed for pathologic study or previously removed)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_45174
DisplayedItem.title: # Isolated tumor cells (ITCs) are defined as small clusters of cells not greater than 0.2 mm or single tumor cells, or a cluster of fewer than 200 cells in a single histologic cross-section. ITCs may be detected by routine histology or by immunohistochemical (IHC) methods. Nodes containing only ITCs are excluded from the total positive node count for purposes of N classification but should be included in the total number of nodes evaluated.

ListItem.name: LI_41324
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis identified or ITCs only#

ListItem.name: LI_42320
ListItem.title: pN0 (i+): ITCs only (malignant cell clusters no larger than 0.2 mm) in regional lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_50126
ListItem.title: pN0 (mol+): Positive molecular findings by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT- PCR); no ITCs detected

ListItem.name: LI_49980
ListItem.title: pN1mi: Micrometastases (approximately 200 cells, larger than 0.2 mm, but none larger than 2.0 mm)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50976
DisplayedItem.title: ## Approximately 1000 tumor cells are contained in a 3-dimensional 0.2-mm cluster. Thus, if more than 200 individual tumor cells are identified as single dispersed tumor cells or as a nearly confluent elliptical or spherical focus in a single histologic section of a lymph node, there is a high probability that more than 1000 cells are present in the lymph node. In these situations, the node should be classified as containing a micrometastasis (pN1mi). Cells in different lymph node cross-sections or longitudinal sections or levels of the block are not added together; the 200 cells must be in a single node profile even if the node has been thinly sectioned into multiple slices. It is recognized that there is substantial overlap between the upper limit of the ITC and the lower limit of the micrometastasis categories due to inherent limitations in pathologic nodal evaluation and detection of minimal tumor burden in lymph nodes. Thus, the threshold of 200 cells in a single cross-section is a guideline to help pathologists distinguish between these 2 categories. The pathologist should use judgment regarding whether it is likely that the cluster of cells represents a true micrometastasis or is simply a small group of isolated tumor cells.

ListItem.name: LI_pN1a_39947

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59867
DisplayedItem.title: Completion of the template is the responsibility of the laboratory performing the biomarker testing and / or providing the interpretation. When both testing and interpretation are performed elsewhere (e.g., a reference laboratory), synoptic reporting of the results by the laboratory submitting the tissue for testing is also encouraged to ensure that all information is included in the patient's medical record and thus readily available to the treating clinical team.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39160

Reporting elements are required only if applicable and only for tests performed. If some studies were performed on different specimen(s), the specimen number(s) should be provided.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_42277
DisplayedItem.title: ## When a tumor is negative but no internal control cells are present, the pathologist must exercise judgment as to whether the assay can be interpreted as a true negative. This should include consideration of histologic type and grade, cold ischemia and fixation times, and the status of external controls. If the pathologist decides that hormone receptor status cannot be determined, the test should be reported as such and repeated on another block or specimen.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_45967
DisplayedItem.title: ### Technical issues prevent the test from being reported as positive, negative, or equivocal. This may occur if specimen handling was inadequate, if artifacts (crush or edge artifacts) make interpretation difficult, or if the analytic testing failed.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_44799
DisplayedItem.title: If internal mammary lymph nodes, infraclavicular nodes (level III axillary), or supraclavicular lymph nodes are included in the specimen, consult the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual for additional lymph node categories.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_49416
DisplayedItem.title: Note: (sn) and (f) suffixes should be added to the N category to denote confirmation of metastasis by sentinel node biopsy or FNA / core needle biopsy respectively, with NO further resection of nodes.

ListItem.name: LI_pNX_44968
ListItem.title: pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., not removed for pathologic study or previously removed)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59203
DisplayedItem.title: # Isolated tumor cells (ITCs) are defined as small clusters of cells not greater than 0.2 mm or single tumor cells, or a cluster of fewer than 200 cells in a single histologic cross-section. ITCs may be detected by routine histology or by immunohistochemical (IHC) methods. Nodes containing only ITCs are excluded from the total positive node count for purposes of N classification but should be included in the total number of nodes evaluated.

ListItem.name: LI_pN0_58739
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis identified or ITCs only#

ListItem.name: LI_pN0i_52725
ListItem.title: pN0 (i+): ITCs only (malignant cell clusters no larger than 0.2 mm) in regional lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_pN0_46196
ListItem.title: pN0 (mol+): Positive molecular findings by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT- PCR); no ITCs detected

ListItem.name: LI_pN0mi_59864
ListItem.title: pN1mi: Micrometastases (approximately 200 cells, larger than 0.2 mm, but none larger than 2.0 mm)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37534
DisplayedItem.title: ## Approximately 1000 tumor cells are contained in a 3-dimensional 0.2-mm cluster. Thus, if more than 200 individual tumor cells are identified as single dispersed tumor cells or as a nearly confluent elliptical or spherical focus in a single histologic section of a lymph node, there is a high probability that more than 1000 cells are present in the lymph node. In these situations, the node should be classified as containing a micrometastasis (pN1mi). Cells in different lymph node cross-sections or longitudinal sections or levels of the block are not added together; the 200 cells must be in a single node profile even if the node has been thinly sectioned into multiple slices. It is recognized that there is substantial overlap between the upper limit of the ITC and the lower limit of the micrometastasis categories due to inherent limitations in pathologic nodal evaluation and detection of minimal tumor burden in lymph nodes. Thus, the threshold of 200 cells in a single cross-section is a guideline to help pathologists distinguish between these 2 categories. The pathologist should use judgment regarding whether it is likely that the cluster of cells represents a true micrometastasis or is simply a small group of isolated tumor cells.
